intro: Schlegelia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered schlegelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features compact growth with small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Schlegelia parviflora is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
